Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Cecropin 2 (Md-Cec; Mdc; M. domestica cecropin; natural AMPs; UCLL1, insects, arthropods,  invertebrates, animals; BBL; BBMm; BBN)
Sequence Information.Source: the Medfly,Ceratitis capitata; also housefly,Musca domestica

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: Found in multiple species. The same peptide was also found in housefly (Liang Y et al. 2006 Dev Comp Immunol 30: 249-57). It has been recombinantly expressed in different manners. Mdc can interact with LPS, permeate membranes, and subsequently bind to DNA (Lu X et al. 2012 Appl Microbiol Biotechnol DOI 10.1007/s00253-011-3793-2). Updated 1/2012.
Literature Information.Author: Rosetto M, Manetti AGO, Marchini D, Dallai R., Telford JL.1993
Literature Information.Title: Sequences of two cDNA clones from the medfly Ceratitis capitata encoding antibacterial peptides of the cecropin family.
